activity: Using a bench grinder for sharpening tools such as woodworking tools and grinding metals.

before: Ensure you are familiar with equipment controls and operation.
Inspect surrounding area and remove any tripping or slipping hazards.
Inspect the grinding wheel for cracks - do not use if cracked.
Ensure you are using the correct grinding wheel.
After turning on the grinder, step aside and ensure grinding wheel is running true (not wobbling). If wobbling, switch off grinder and mark as "do not use".
during: Wait for the grinding wheel to reach maximum speed before use.
Do not use the flat sides of grinding wheel.
Use the rounded area near the most protruding section of the grinding wheel (never above or below).
Dress the grinding wheel to level the surface and remove grooves.
Always hold the work piece with both hands, except very small pieces.
Do not hold work piece with cloth or pliers.
Use the grinding wheel's full width to reduce uneven wear.
Do not leave grinder running unattended.
after: Do not use grinder while wheel is slowing down.
Remove dust and swarf from grinder and workbench.

controls: Loose clothing and long hair to be tied back.
Inspect grinding wheel for cracks before use.

hazard: Being pushed onto spinning grinding wheel
controls: Ensure any other person in the vicinity is aware of operation in progress.
